title: Project Associate Interview
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews: phone screen with HR, language check, and panel interview. The interviews themselves were pleasant enough. I waited quite a long time between stages 1 and 2, and ultimately nobody reached out to inform on the hiring decision.
Interview Questions: How do you manage competing priorities/deadlines?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ACDI/VOCA in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process was very straightforward. I met with different people throughout the three rounds of the process. Everyone was very nice, and I knew what to expect before each interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Business Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at ACDI/VOCA in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Multiple phases of interviews culminating in a panel interview. In the panel , the previous job holder was involved and asked a majority of the questions pertaining to the role and qualifications.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked on USAID bids?

title: BDS Interview
Interview Descriptions: the interview process is good, transparent and natural process.  Which is good related to the job description, experience and other supporting information.  the topolice ,exwricise. do to low level of intevention. This would be natural phenomena.
Interview Questions: why you apply to this job?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Interview Descriptions: I was selected for an initial phone interview. Then I never heard back...I found it extremely unprofessional to begin an interview process and then never hear back. A simple generic email letting me know that they chose to go with another candidate would have sufficed.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for us?

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at ACDI/VOCA (Washington, DC) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Had two interviews, first with a recruiter then with a project assistant in French. I thought both interviews went well but it's been two months and I haven't heard back, not even an automated email to say the position had been filled.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ACDI/VOCA (Washington, DC) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: First phone interview was a regular screening with HR department. I read the organization's annual report which was very useful to answer questions. I received an email shortly after to schedule a second interview via skype.

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at ACDI/VOCA
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter shortly after applying online and had a phone screening where I was asked typical questions about my background and interest in the organization. The process moved fairly quickly, and I was invited to the office for an interview with two managing directors and the recruiter. I was later given a language screening over the phone, which was a short conversation with a Spanish-speaking staff member. I was told the process was still ongoing a couple weeks later, and then never heard back from the recruiter after that.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your current job and responsibilities.

title: Managing Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ACDI/VOCA (Washington, DC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Very professional and straightforward. Phone call with HR to go over screening questions. Callback the next day for an in-person with VP. 

At the office, was met with HR staff to review benefits and then met VP. VP was well-informed of my profile, took a genuine interest in my experience and perspective, and asked good questions to gauge my view on the industry. Overall a positive experience.
Interview Questions: What are some of the upcoming new business opportunities that A/V should be looking at?

title: Project Assistant Interview
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone call with questions and then an interview. I received an offer a few weeks later. The interview was with three project managers. Their HR staff is very friendly.
Interview Questions: They partially  interviewed me in Spanish. Asked what my communication style was.

title: M&E Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at ACDI/VOCA (Bishkek) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Learned about the available vacancy, submitted my applications, received a phone call, invited for an interview on Skype. after a a few weeks, received a job offer for the position that i applied.
Interview Questions: the questions were not difficult and were asked questions that i expected

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ACDI/VOCA (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: There are numerous applications initially- must have your resume as relevant as possible to job description (including requirements) to have your resume pulled from the pile. Networking will help at the next level- directly with the department or staff you are trying to work with.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at ACDI/VOCA (Washington, DC) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone screening, followed by an in-person group interview a week later with a few deputy directors, followed by a final interview with a manager the following week (a few days later).  They then informed me that they would check references and get back to me.
Interview Questions: I had not anticipated being interviewed initially by more than one person.  Overall, the process went smoothly and interactions went well with all individuals on the interviewing panel although I did find one of them slightly intimidating.
